src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision

Class ColorImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision.Image
      • src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision.ColorImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Releasable, Writable

    public class ColorImage
extends Image
    This class represents an image of 3-channel color. The class itself naturally works in BGR (note, not RGB), but a developer can pull out matrices of other color channels to work with those if need be. Asking for a color conversion of the same channel more than once doesn't cause it to be re-computed. However manually setting the pixels of this image does wipe out the different calculated images as they're no longer accurate as the pixels have changed. Wraps the OpenCV Mat "class". If a developer extends this class, they must take care to reset the color conversion objects any time they modify the values of the root OpenCV matrix.

        public static ColorImage empty()

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels(byte[] pixels,
                      int width)
        Sets the pixels of this image to the supplied pixels. The pixel array splits the color channels into three parts. So the array should be the form: {pixel1Blue, pixel1Green, pixel1Red, pixel2Blue, pixel2Green, ... etc} The width represents the width of the image. The width does not have to be the width of this image as it is overwritten if it is different.
        Specified by:
        setPixels in class Image
        Parameters:
        pixels - pixels to set this image to
        width - width of the image
